intro: Berkheya dumicola, commonly known as the rock dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. It produces small, oval-shaped seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Berkheya dumicola is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
